page.title: 13CHURCH FARM MUSEUM
page.content: Church FARM Museum is the oldest house in Hendon.In the late seventeenth century it was owned by the Kemp Family. The freehold was bought by George Dunlop in 1842 and remained in that family until sold to the Council in 1944. The Museum today is very interesting, it has pieces of antique furniture and many Victorian accessories.The kitchen is as it was over 100 years ago.It makes you realise just how much times have changed. One of the most interesting pieces of equipment is the nutmeg grater. In the garden is a large pond and two big trees, a cedar and a yew. There is an old well and a gate.The garden features little but is kept in good condition. The Museum is well worth a visit. .
